thread.title: Fantasy football must start: Broncos TE Owen Daniels vs. Raiders
thread.title_full: Fantasy football must start: Broncos TE Owen Daniels vs. Raiders

title: Fantasy football must start: Broncos TE Owen Daniels vs. Raiders
text:
By Neil Greenberg October 9 at 5:30 AM Follow @ngreenberg Broncos tight end Owen Daniels has a touchdown in each of his last two games. (Ron Chenoy-USA TODAY Sports) 
The Oakland Raiders have been a treasure trove of fantasy points for opposing tight ends. They have allowed 18.7 points per game to the position, five more than the next worst team, the New York Giants. 
In Week 1, Bengals’ tight end Tyler Eifert was targeted 12 times, making nine catches for 104 yards and two touchdowns. 
In Week 2, Ravens’ tight end Crockett Gillmore caught 5 of 6 for 88 yards and two touchdowns. 
In Week 3, Browns’ tight end Gary Barnidge caught 6 of the 9 passes thrown his way for 105 yards and a score. 
In Week 4, Bears’ tight end Martellus Bennett caught 11 of 13 passes for 83 yards and a touchdown. 
This week, Owen Daniels of the Denver Broncos gets a shot. 
Daniels has a touchdown in each of the last two games and gets some looks in the red zone from quarterback Peyton Manning. 
It all comes down to the two tight end formation, which is a staple of Kubiak’s system. 
“ You force a defense to make a decision ,” Daniels explained to Cameron Wolf of the the Denver Post. “Do they want to keep their base personnel in there to stop the run or do they want put a nickel guy in there to stop the pass. Either way, whatever they decide to do we have to make them wrong. We have had a lot of success with that specific personnel grouping.” 
That success should continue on Sunday. Neil Greenberg analyzes advanced sports statistics for the Fancy Stats blog and prefers to be called a geek rather than a nerd. sports Success! Check your inbox for details. You might also like: Please enter a valid email address Sign Up
